_header: Lucy of light after Januences purpose
Note: Bokenham refers to Jacobus de Voraigne as Ianuence/Januence.
Subjects: Lucy, saint, life of; saints’ lives
Bibliographic Ghosts: New Haven, Yale University, Beinecke Library 163 [olim Wagstaff 9, prior Petworth 8], f. 186v.
_description: Bokenham’s Life of St. Lucy — Prologue three 8-line stanzas; Life in couplets

BLAru327.First Lines:
Lucye of lyht aftyr Jaunencys purposeTakyth þe name by
                    dyryuacyoun…
BLAru327.Last Lines:
…Granth vs in virtue so strong to beThat no maner vyce vs mow
                    apeyre
BLAru327.Attributed Author:
Translated into englys be a doctor of dyuyinte clepyd Osbern
                    Bokenam…Wrytyn in Cambryge by hys sonn ffrer Thomas Burgh (index, f.
                    193)
BLAru327.Attributed Title:
The prologue of seynt Lucye (rubric, f. 163) And seynt Lucye (index, f.
                    193)
